Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) is the National Standards Body of India established under the BIS Act 2016. It is responsible for the development of standards, marking, and quality certification of goods in India. BIS ensures the provision of safe, reliable quality goods, minimizes health hazards to consumers, promotes exports and imports substitute, and controls the proliferation of varieties through standardization, certification, and testing. Additionally, BIS has prepared the National Building Code of India 2016, which provides guidelines for regulating building construction activities across the country.
